summary: In this context, 1,1,2,2-tetrachloroethene (a chlorinated volatile organic compound) is mentioned as part of a discussion on the remediation of groundwater contaminated with chlorinated volatile organic compounds (CVOCs). The text highlights the use of nanoscale zero valent iron (NZVI) for the treatment of such organic chemicals, indicating a direct relationship between 1,1,2,2-tetrachloroethene and the broader category of organic chemicals, particularly in the context of environmental remediation efforts.
